title: Kirchhoff loop - 10 20 and 30 ohms - 60 V battery

content.question: The figure shows three resistors connected to a battery, with the resistances and <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>emf</mtext></math> indicated. Which of the following correctly ranks the potential differences <math alttext="delta V sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="delta V sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="delta V sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> across resistors <math alttext="R sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="R sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="R sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="delta V sub 1 equals delta V sub 2, which equals delta V sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="delta V sub 1 is greater than delta V sub 2, which is greater than delta V sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="delta V sub 2 is greater than delta V sub 1, which equals delta V sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="delta V sub 3 is greater than delta V sub 2, which is greater than delta V sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="delta V sub 1 equals delta V sub 2, which equals delta V sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
